definition: to do one's filial duty
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
to the greatest extent/(when used before a noun of location) furthest or extreme/to be within the limits of/to give priority to
filial piety or obedience/mourning apparel

sentences.english: If you can practice filialty, you will not fight with your brothers and sisters.
sentences.chinese: 你若能尽孝道，一定不会和兄弟姐妹争利益。

sentences.english: To be filial is in fact the most rewarding thing in life.
sentences.chinese: 对父母尽孝，是人生最大的福气。

sentences.english: Her sister praised cheung Po tsai for father try dew filial, make cheung Po tsai in a good mood.
sentences.chinese: 娣妹大赞张保仔为父试甘露尽孝，令张保仔心情大好。

sentences.english: And sometimes I try to be MOM's good boy.
sentences.chinese: 所以咯，有时我也要尽尽孝嗒。

sentences.english: What do you have to do to be considered filial to your parents?
sentences.chinese: 对父母的孝顺，要怎样才算尽孝呢？

definition: filial piety (Confucian virtue)/to be a good son or daughter
filial/dutiful/devoted to one's parents (and grandparents etc)/to show filial piety towards (an older family member)/filial piety
of all virtues filial piety is most important (idiom)
unfilial
to look after (elderly parents)/to serve/to support
to look after one's aged parents and arrange proper burial after they die
filial piety (a Confucian obligation)/respect and obedience to one's parents
filial piety or obedience/mourning apparel
parents
to support/to provide support for/to maintain
descendant
to pay one's last respects
children/sons and daughters
filial son
to show filial respect/to give presents (to one's elders or superiors)/to support one's aged parents
to display utter loyalty/to be loyal to the end
